title: UNSC report: TRF published Pahalgam attack site photo, claimed responsibility twice
content: A UN Security Council report has implicated The Resistance Front (TRF), a proxy of Lashkar-e-Tayyiba (LeT), in the deadly Pahalgam attack. The report, explicitly mentions TRF's involvement and highlights the links between TRF and LeT, supported by Pakistan.

title: SC reserves verdict on Justice Varma's plea - What the top court said
content: The Supreme Court has reserved its decision on Justice Yashwant Varma's challenge to a report finding him culpable in a cash discovery matter. The court questioned Varma's participation in the inquiry without initially contesting its validity. His counsel argued that the panel's removal suggestion violated constitutional principles, emphasizing the problematic precedent it would establish.

title: Elon Musk corrects 'hiring post' of xAI's Aditya Gupta: Says Starting today...
content: Elon Musk's xAI is doing away with the title "researcher," opting for "engineer" for all technical roles, a decision prompted by Musk's direct intervention on X. This move aims to eliminate what Musk sees as a two-tiered system, aligning xAI with companies like OpenAI and Anthropic that favor unified technical titles.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Gambhir's message to Jurel: 'Mauka milega, ready rehna'
content: Twice in the five-match series, Dhruv Jurel was asked to don the wicketkeeping gloves — and the 24-year-old didn’t disappoint his captain. In the third Test, after coming on as a substitute keeper, he took three catches. In the fourth Test, he displayed sharp reflexes behind the stumps, effecting two stumpings and taking two catches.

title: Flight passengers evacuate via emergency slides after smoke detected — Watch
content: A Turkish Airlines Boeing 777 was evacuated at Antalya Airport after smoke emerged from the landing gear following its arrival from Istanbul. Emergency teams advised the evacuation as a precautionary measure, and all passengers were safely evacuated without any injuries. Preliminary investigations suggest a faulty hydraulic pipe caused the smoke, and the aircraft is undergoing technical assessment.

title: 'Security protocol': Why Divya played World Cup-winning move inside empty venue
content: Divya Deshmukh made history by winning the FIDE Women's World Cup in Batumi. The 19-year-old defeated Grandmaster (GM) Koneru Humpy in a tense tie-break. Spectators were absent during the final moments due to FIDE regulations. Divya's victory marks a significant moment for Indian women's chess. She also became India’s 88th Grandmaster.

title: Russia earthquake: Tsunami warning issued for Hawaii; What Tsunami Warning, Watch and Advisory mean
content: A massive 8.8 magnitude earthquake off Russia's coast has triggered tsunami warnings across the Pacific, including Alaska, Hawaii, and the US West Coast. A tsunami warning indicates that a tsunami is either already occurring or is expected to hit soon. Officials are cautioning residents to move inland, especially near Northern California, where waves could reach 5.5 feet.

title: Ports destroyed, whales washed ashore: Tsunami hits Russian, Japanese coasts - Watch
content: A strong earthquake struck off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula. It triggered a large tsunami. Coastal areas faced evacuation. Submerged buildings and massive water drenching were seen. The quake's magnitude was 8.7. Tsunami waves reached up to 4 meters. Warnings issued for Japan, Hawaii, and other Pacific regions. People were asked to leave their homes. The earthquake was the strongest in decades.

title: Explained: Why are WBJEE 2024 results delayed?
content: The WBJEE 2024 results remain stalled nearly three months after the exam, as a legal dispute over OBC reservations halts their release. Despite being ready on June 5, the board cited its lack of authority amid the sub-judice matter. The delay has sparked widespread anxiety among students and disrupted academic schedules across engineering colleges in Bengal.

title: ITR-3 enabled for e-filing: Key things to know before filing for AY 2025–26
content: The Income Tax Department has facilitated online ITR-3 filing for AY 2025-26, benefiting individuals with income from share trading, business ventures, and unlisted shares. Key updates include mandatory Form 10-IEA selection, revised capital gains reporting, and higher asset/liability reporting thresholds. Filers must also provide detailed disclosures on TDS sections and deductions.

title: TCS layoffs: Ex Tech Mahindra CEO CP Gurnani quotes Sholay - message to techies
content: Amidst TCS layoffs, CP Gurnani urges the Indian tech industry to move beyond headcount obsession and embrace outcome-based models. He emphasizes a shift from the traditional pyramid structure, advocating for enhanced productivity, specialized skills, and advanced technological capabilities. Experts suggest that upskilling and reskilling are crucial for tech professionals in this evolving landscape.

title: Mercedes stranded on flooded road for 2 hours: Ghaziabad man sends legal notice to GMC
content: A Ghaziabad resident, Amit Kishore, has demanded ₹5 lakh from the municipal commissioner after his Mercedes broke down on a waterlogged Sahibabad road during heavy rains. Kishore claims the car malfunctioned after being stranded for two hours and the repairs are estimated at ₹5 lakh.Claims Rs 5L loss after Mercedes breakdown

title: IND vs ENG: Oval curator faces heat from Gambhir, Indian staff call out ‘double standards’
content: Tensions flared between India's head coach Gautam Gambhir and Oval curator Lee Fortis ahead of the crucial fifth Test. A heated exchange, caught on camera, arose after Fortis allegedly behaved rudely towards India's support staff and restricted the team's pitch inspection.

title: Indian refinery reels from EU sanctions blow; new challenges as shippers…
content: EU sanctions on Russian oil are causing significant disruptions for Nayara Energy, a Russian-backed Indian refinery. Shipping companies are terminating contracts, and Microsoft has suspended IT services, impacting the refinery's operations.

title: Watch: Flight passenger starts crying, banging door on being told to pay extra
content: A Ryanair passenger's distress at Sofia Airport went viral after she was denied boarding due to her bag's size. The woman's emotional plea, captured on video, showed her begging and even striking a door. Despite managing to fit her bag into the sizer, she was still refused.

title: Exclusive: ‘I took inspiration from Milkha, Mary Kom movie songs’ - Divya
content: Speaking exclusively with TOI from Batumi airport in Georgia, Divya talked at length and shared her thoughts on how it feels to be a Grandmaster, how she turned things around in her favour and the favourite dress she wore during all her tiebreak games to script history.

title: Balotra village flooded with toxic water: Residents told to evacuate
content: Kalyanpur officials ordered immediate evacuation of Araba Purohitan residents. Homes flooded with chemical waste from textile factories. Around 300 people are relocating. This problem has persisted for years. No drains were constructed to divert polluted water. Similar conditions prevail in neighboring villages. Illegal textile units discharge chemical waste into the Jojari River. Farmland is becoming infertile.

title: Op Shivshakti: 2 terrorists killed in J&K's Poonch; weapons cache recovered
content: An encounter initiated in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch sector on Wednesday after security forces intercepted a group of terrorists attempting to infiltrate from across the border. Army officials reported that gunfire was exchanged, and two terrorists were hit. The operation is currently underway as troops investigate the area.

title: ITBP bus falls into river in J&K: Driver injured, weapons missing
content: In Jammu and Kashmir's Ganderbal district, a bus carrying Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel plunged into the Sindh River at Kullan amidst heavy rainfall on Wednesday. The vehicle veered off the Kullan bridge, prompting immediate response from SDRF teams. Rescue operations are underway.

title: Historic! KL Rahul 45 runs away from massive Gavaskar record
content: KL Rahul is close to breaking Sunil Gavaskar's record. This is for the most runs by an Indian opener in England. Rahul has 1108 runs, needing 45 more. In the fourth Test, India struggled early. Rahul and Shubman Gill formed a crucial partnership. Rahul scored 90, while Gill, Ravindra Jadeja, and Washington Sundar hit centuries.

title: Bengaluru hideout busted: Jharkhand woman linked to terror cells nabbed; Gujarat ATS alleges foreign ties
content: A 30-year-old woman named Shama Parveen from Jharkhand was apprehended in Bengaluru by the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS). She was allegedly in communication with terror modules and disseminating radical content online. Parveen, who resided with her brother, is suspected of being a sympathizer of banned organizations and was observed following individuals previously arrested by the ATS in other states.

title: Tata Motors looks to buy Italian truck maker Iveco; deal likely at $4.5 bn
content: Tata Motors is reportedly on the verge of acquiring Italian truck manufacturer Iveco from the Agnelli family for $4.5 billion, marking the Tata Group's second-largest acquisition after Corus. The deal, excluding Iveco's defense operations, is expected to be announced soon, pending board approvals from both companies.

title: India vs Pakistan in WCL: 'Not just another game' - Sponsor withdraws
content: EaseMyTrip has withdrawn its sponsorship from the World Championship of Legends semi-final match between India Champions and Pakistan Champions, citing its policy against supporting events involving Pakistan due to concerns over terrorism. The decision follows a previous cancellation of a league stage match between the two teams.

title: Agra man in merchant navy dies after falling into sea from docked ship in Indonesia
content: A merchant navy officer from Agra, Manish Chandra Yadav, tragically died after falling into the sea from a docked vessel near Batam Island, Indonesia. The 33-year-old chief officer, employed by Navsug Marine Services, slipped while boarding the ship from a jetty. His body is being repatriated to India, leaving behind his wife and two young children.

title: Troy Pannell jailed for contempt of court: Ex‑AFL umpire admits selling racehorse amid frozen assets
content: Troy Pannell, a former Australian Football League umpire, has been jailed. He ignored court orders related to an $8.7 million fraud case. Pannell violated asset-freeze conditions. He also misled the court about his finances. The judge found his actions showed disregard for the law. He received an 11-week sentence. SeaRoad Shipping is still pursuing a civil claim against Pannell.

title: 'I'm against IND vs PAK, PM Modi saying Op Sindoor is on pause’: Ex-India cricketer
content: Manoj Tiwary, former Indian cricketer, strongly opposes the India-Pakistan Asia Cup 2025 match, citing recent terror attacks and military operations. He believes playing Pakistan sends the wrong message amidst heightened tensions, referencing the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor. While condemning terrorism, Sourav Ganguly offered a contrasting view, emphasizing that sport should continue.

title: High uric acid levels: Know causes and symptoms; try these natural ways to lower them
content: High uric acid can lead to gout and kidney issues. Diet changes can help manage it. Reduce purine-rich foods like red meat. Avoid sugary drinks and alcohol. Staying hydrated is key for flushing out uric acid. Moderate coffee intake may help. Weight loss and managing blood sugar are beneficial. Fibre and vitamin C are important.

title: Gold price prediction today: Where is gold rate headed in the near-term?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold rates are poised for a limited upside due to emerging clarity on US trade policies. Recent US-EU trade deals and an extended US-China tariff truce have reduced demand for safe-haven assets like gold.

title: Suniel Shetty says Ahan was removed from films due to him: 'Mere se naaraaz honge...
content: Suniel Shetty reveals Ahan Shetty faced industry challenges, allegedly sidelined after signing 'Border 2,' despite his lineage. Suniel believes Ahan's role in 'Border 2' has fostered valuable relationships, including Varun Dhawan and Diljit Dosanjh. He emphasizes hard work over shortcuts, hoping for 'Border 2's' success and Ahan's recognition alongside established stars.

title: 'Are we still stuck in the colonial era?' - Pathan on Gambhir vs The Oval pitch curator saga
content: Tensions flared ahead of the final Test between India and England as a heated argument erupted between India's coach, Gautam Gambhir, and pitch curator Lee Fortis over pitch access. Irfan Pathan's social media post ignited a debate about double standards, questioning why England's coach had pitch access while Gambhir did not.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 81,400 as US tariffs worries loom
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Wednesday as worries of 20-25% US tariffs on India loomed. While Nifty50 was near 24,800, BSE Sensex was up around 70 points.

title: 'Trump coiled around Modi like a snake': Cong renews attack over US President’s ceasefire claims
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has criticized PM Modi, referencing Donald Trump's claims of brokering peace between India and Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack. Khera's remarks followed Rahul Gandhi's challenge to Modi to refute Trump's assertions in Parliament. Modi responded by stating no foreign leader requested a halt to Operation Sindoor, directly countering Trump's narrative.

title: 18 balls in one over? Pakistan vs Australia witnesses bizarre moment - Watch
content: In a World Championship of Legends 2025 match, John Hastings bowled a strange over. The over included 12 wides and a no-ball. Pakistan Champions were chasing a small target. Saeed Ajmal took six wickets, dismantling Australia Champions. Sharjeel Khan and Sohaib Maqsood easily secured a 10-wicket victory for Pakistan. Hastings's over became a talking point among fans.

title: ‘Honeymoon in Shillong’: Film on Raja Raghuvanshi murder announced
content: The Raja Raghuvanshi murder case, which involved allegations of his wife and accomplices killing him during their honeymoon in Shillong, is set to be depicted in a film titled ‘Honeymoon in Shillong.’ Raja's brother unveiled the film's poster, stating it aims to portray the events leading to Raja's death and the circumstances surrounding the case.

title: 'Play only continued for some personal gain' - Steyn on India refusing to Stokes' draw offer
content: The Manchester Test ended in a draw, but debate continues. England offered a draw, but India played on. Dale Steyn criticised India's decision, alleging pursuit of personal milestones. Tabraiz Shamsi defended India's choice. Steyn and Shamsi debated the spirit of the game. A fan accused Steyn of double standards. The final Test begins July 31 amid ongoing tension.

title: Haryana cop sacked over ‘evil soul’ leave, HC upholds dismissal
content: The Punjab and Haryana High Court upheld the dismissal of a Haryana Police constable, Arshad, due to his habitual absence from duty. His medical records cited "evil soul/black magic treatment," but the court emphasized that a disciplined force cannot retain indisciplined members.

title: Taylor Swift hijacks NFL spotlight with Kelce: Sparks nearly $1 billion 'Swift Effect'
content: Pop star Taylor Swift's relationship with Travis Kelce boosted the Kansas City Chiefs. The team saw a huge increase in fans, especially women. Kelce's jersey sales skyrocketed. TV ratings for Chiefs games broke records. Swift's presence added millions to the team's value. Kelce became a celebrity beyond sports. Their relationship transformed football into a cultural phenomenon.

title: 'Country will be shocked': Why PM Modi slammed Nehru's Indus Waters treaty - 'facts kept hidden'
content: PM Modi criticized the Indus Waters Treaty, highlighting a clause where Nehru allegedly conceded to Pakistan's demands, preventing India from desilting dams and even welding shut a gate on one. Modi claimed this decision, which Nehru later regretted, deprived Indian farmers of water and electricity, benefiting Pakistan at India's expense. India has since suspended the treaty and initiated desilting efforts.

title: 'India good friend but ... ': Trump hints at 20-25% tariff rate
content: President Trump indicated a potential 20-25% tariff on Indian goods, slightly less than the previously announced 26%, amidst ongoing trade negotiations. He stated India's high tariffs prompted the consideration, despite acknowledging their friendship. This levy positions India competitively with Bangladesh in textiles, but behind Vietnam and Indonesia.

title: ‘Significant positive impact’: Australia to ban children from YouTube
content: Australia is set to ban children under 16 from creating YouTube accounts starting in December, reversing its earlier stance. Prime Minister Albanese cites the negative impact of social media on Australian kids, emphasizing the government's support for parents. This decision follows concerns raised by the internet regulator and a survey revealing harmful content encountered by minors on the platform.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for July 30 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers recommends buying Mazagon Dock, Vascon Engineers, and Thermax. Mazagon Dock presents a mean reversion opportunity, while Vascon Engineers shows inverse Head & Shoulders pattern with demand zone support. Thermax appears to be retesting after a breakout, indicating a potential uptrend resumption.

title: Head, Hazlewood to return; Marsh to captain Australia - full squad announced
content: Australia have revealed their squads for the South Africa series. Matt Short returns, and Mitch Owen earns his first call-up. Mitchell Marsh will captain the ODI side in Pat Cummins's absence. Travis Head and Josh Hazlewood are back. Select players have been dropped from the previous West Indies series. The team is gearing up for the T20 World Cup.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Kwan to Jays? Maybe, but pitching comes first
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on Thursday approaches.

title: The one trade our experts would make before the deadline
content: We asked our MLB experts for the one fun, outside-the-box deal they'd make to get things moving along.

title: Shooter targeted NFL HQ, claimed to have CTE
content: A gunman who killed four people at a Manhattan office building was trying to target the headquarters of the NFL but took the wrong elevator.

title: Braves' Acuna 'worried,' IL-bound due to Achilles
content: Ronald Acuna Jr. exited Atlanta's loss at Kansas City on Tuesday night because of tightness in his right Achilles after chasing down a ball in right field.

title: Browns' Emerson carted off with Achilles injury
content: Browns cornerback Martin Emerson Jr. was carted off the field during Tuesday's practice after suffering an Achilles injury.

title: Jays, Orioles get deal done during doubleheader
content: The Blue Jays have acquired reliever Seranthony Dominguez from the Orioles for pitching prospect Juaron Watts-Brown.

title: Rare Ohtani first: Dodgers star K's in first 4 PAs
content: Dodgers two-way star Shohei Ohtani had another first in his MLB career when he struck out in his first four plate appearances Tuesday night.

title: Sources: Hendrickson set to end Bengals holdout
content: Bengals All-Pro defensive end Trey Hendrickson is set to end his holdout and report for training camp on Wednesday, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Brink is back: Sparks return 'like riding a bike'
content: Over a year after tearing an ACL, Cameron Brink finished with 5 points, 3 rebounds, 1 steal and 1 block in limited minutes in the Sparks' loss to the Aces.

title: Sources: Vancouver close to sealing Müller deal
content: The Vancouver Whitecaps are closing in on a deal to sign former Bayern Munich and Germany star Thomas Müller, sources told ESPN.

title: Power Rankings: Sparks, Valkyries headed in opposite directions
content: Los Angeles rides a win streak (and Cameron Brink's return) up the latest edition, and Golden State struggles.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the trade deadline.

title: Can Bronny James realistically make the Lakers’ rotation in Year 2?
content: After spending Year 1 working away from the spotlight, James hopes it'll translate into playing time with Los Angeles.

title: 'I'm getting that true balance': Dak Prescott's perspective as a dad and longest-tenured Cowboy
content: The quarterback enters Year 10 with the Cowboys, and he is focused on health, family and winning a Super Bowl.

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the 2025 MLB trade deadline
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: 11 college football teams ready to either build on last season or put it behind them
content: FSU has nowhere to go but up, Michigan can get way better and Arizona State is building on its CFP berth. Which other teams are primed for bigger things in 2025?

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Houston is No. 1, and we'll have a new WAC champ
content: Grand Canyon moved up its timeline to switch from the WAC to the Mountain West, which significantly shifts the bracket dynamics.

title: Liverpool won the Premier League and now they're on a spending spree. Why?
content: Fresh off winning the Premier League with few reinforcements, Liverpool are now splashing the cash in the summer transfer window ahead of the 2025-26 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United target Pope, Donnarumma in goalkeeper search
content: Newcastle's Nick Pope and Paris Saint-Germain's Gianluigi Donnarumma are attracting interest from Man United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Liverpool still want Alexander Isak amid massive summer spending
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Isak is about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: They (finally) meet again: Three keys to Liberty-Lynx WNBA Finals rematch
content: Injuries and new matchups will determine Wednesday's showdown, nine months after New York beat Minnesota for the title.

title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: 'Just a top-shelf human being': Teammates, opponents remember Ryne Sandberg
content: Beloved on and off the field, Sandberg leaves a lasting legacy in Chicago and throughout the baseball universe.

title: How Ichiro's HOF induction helps tell the story of Japanese baseball
content: On Ichiro Suzuki's induction weekend, a new exhibit in Cooperstown shares his place in the international baseball landscape.

title: Reliever stock watch: Guardians look to Cade Smith
content: As the MLB trade deadline approaches this week, here are the relief pitchers and closers to keep an eye on in fantasy baseball.

title: Six late-round 'fliers' who can help you win your league
content: Hitting on a player late in drafts can be a big boost -- to your team and your ego. Here are six "fliers" you need to be considering.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton proposes to girlfriend Jade Jones
content: Haliburton staged the proposal inside Hilton Coliseum on the Iowa State campus, where the couple began dating.

title: 'The story's not done yet': England celebrate Euro 2025 win with London parade
content: England partied with 65,000 fans (and Burna Boy) outside Buckingham Palace after winning Euro 2025. But they already have one eye on the World Cup.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: Assamese Actor Arrested After Student Killed In Guhawati Hit-And-Run
content: Assamese actor Nandini Kashyap has been arrested in a hit-and-run case in Guwahati that claimed the life of a 21-year-old student, said police sources.

title: Earthquake Of Magnitude 4 Strikes Tibet, Second In A Day
content: Second earthquake struck Tibet on Wednesday, measuring 4.0 magnitude, a statement by the National Center for Seismology (NCS) said.

title: Opinion: Opinion | How Cholas Laid The Groundwork For Microlocal Governance In Southeast Asia
content: Chola models of governance played a significant role in opening up a participatory democratic structure within local contexts.

title: Video: Russia Earthquake Shakes Operating Room, Surgeons Keep Working
content: A powerful earthquake of magnitude 8.8 -- one of the strongest ever recorded -- struck Russia's sparsely populated far eastern Kamchatka peninsula early on Wednesday, causing strong tremors and tsunamis up to four metres (12 feet) across the Pacific.

title: Navi Mumbai Teacher Arrested After Video Call With Student. She Was Semi-Nude
content: A school teacher in Navi Mumbai has been arrested after an alleged semi-nude video chat with a minor student. The 35-year-old woman has been charged in an FIR under the stringent Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act

title: 'Marathon At F1 Speed': China Bids To Lap US In AI Leadership
content: Beyond dancing robots and eager-to-help digital avatars, Shanghai's World AI Conference saw China stake its claim to global artificial intelligence leadership and frame itself as a clear alternative to the United States.

title: India-UK Ties To Grow 'Bigger, Broader, Deeper' Under Vision 2035
content: Deputy British High Commissioner to India, Christina Scott, stated that the UK-India relationship is poised for significant expansion under the India-UK Vision 2035 roadmap, introduced by PM Modi and Keir Starmer.

title: "Vedas Protects Those Who Nuture It": Madras High Court Judge
content: When Vedas are protected, it will guard those who nurture it and a court verdict brought him that realisation, Madras High Court Judge, Justice GR Swaminathan has said.

title: Income Tax Department Enables Online Filing Of ITR Form Number 3
content: The Income Tax Department informed that it has enabled online filing of the ITR form number 3. Taxpayers who have business income, income from share trading, or even investments in unlisted shares can now file ITR-3 through the e-filing ITR portal.

title: Rupee Set To Deepen Losses As India Braces For Higher US Tariffs
content: The Indian rupee is poised to weaken past the psychologically important 87-per-dollar level on Wednesday after Donald Trump pointed to a likely 20%-25% tariff on Indian exports to the US, compounding pressure from sustained portfolio outflows.

title: 30-Year-Old Woman, Al Qaeda Terror Module Head, Arrested From Bengaluru
content: Sama Parveen's arrest comes days after four terrorists associated with the Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent were arrested.

title: Trump's Former Personal Lawyer Confirmed As US Judge
content: US President Donald Trump's former personal lawyer was confirmed by the Senate Tuesday to become a federal appellate judge in a 50-49 partisan vote.

title: 230,000 Killed, Millions Displaced: Remembering 2004 Indian Ocean Tsunami
content: A massive undersea earthquake near Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula triggered tsunami warnings across the Pacific, affecting regions from Japan to Hawaii and parts of the US West Coast.

title: Honeymoon Murder On Screen? Raja Raghuvanshi's Family Okays Movie
content: Family members of Indore-based transport businessman Raja Raghuvanshi, murdered during his honeymoon trip to Meghalaya, have consented to a film on the crime, which caused ripples following the arrest of his wife Sonam and her suspected lover.

title: Tsunami Hits Alaska, Hawaii, Next Set Of Waves May Be 10 Feet High
content: Waves as high as 10 feet are expected to hit Hawaii following an 8.8 magnitude earthquake off the coast of Russia.

title: Heavy Rainfall Causes Flood-Like Situation In Parts Of Rajasthan
content: Heavy rains have triggered a flood-like situation in parts of Rajasthan, with Sawai Madhopur among the worst-affected districts, officials said on Wednesday, adding that road and rail connectivity with Madhya Pradesh has been disrupted.

title: Estimated Tsunami Timings For California, Washington, Oregon
content: The Pacific region is on tsunami alert after a massive 8.8-magnitude earthquake struck off Russia's far eastern coast. Alaska and Hawaii, as well as the entire US West Coast, are bracing for violent waves.

title: Actor Prakash Raj Appears Before Probe Agency ED In Online Betting Case
content: Actor Prakash Raj on Wednesday appeared before the Enforcement Directorate officials here for questioning in a money laundering case linked to illegal online betting and gambling by certain platforms.

title: "Had Darshan Taken A Stance...": Actor Ramya To NDTV On Renukaswamy Murder Case
content: Actor Darshan, who faces a murder case, should urge his fans to refrain from trolling or send threat messages of rape and murder to those who speak out against him, Ramya aka Divya Spandana, his colleague in the Kannada film industry, told NDTV.

title: A Disturbing Trend: Viral Deepfakes Promoting Fake Investment Schemes
content: A deepfake video of Prime Minister Narendra Modi promoting a fake investment scheme has gone viral on Facebook, posing digital risks to lakhs of potential victims.

title: Indian national among two killed in small plane crash in Canada
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read More 9 simple habits that can keep the brain young even after 40 anushka Sen’s inspired top 10 stylish looks Ramya Subramanian redefines fit and fabulous with her energizing pics .

title: Tirunelveli caste killing accused detained under Goondas Act
content: The interrogation of Surjith’s parents, SIs Saravanan and Krishnakumari, who have been placed under suspension after being named in the FIR, is still under way

title: Road to Belagavi airport to be widened
content: A technical committee is looking into the feasibility of building a flyover to connect the airport with the city, the Minister said

title: CAT 2025 registration begins from August 1
content: IIM Kozhikode designated as coordinating institute for CAT 2025. Registration process will remain open till 5 p.m. on September 13

title: Is public art in Hyderabad losing its local touch?
content: Murals and sculptures brighten up flyovers and traffic islands in Hyderabad, but artists feel many lack cultural context and local relevance

title: Eviction drive under way for second day in Assam to clear encroachment on 1,500 hectares of forest land
content: “The exercise, once completed, will displace around 1,500 families, mostly from the Muslim community,” officials said

title: National child rights commission orders probe into alleged DYFI disruption of mid-day meal, assault of cook at school in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Complainant says disruption violated National Food Security Act 2013 and Mid-Day Meal Rules 2015 that guarantee a free cooked meal to children up to Class 6 on all school working days

title: Pahalgam terror attack: UNSC monitoring report mentions TRF
content: The report by the UNSC's Monitoring Team quoted one unnamed member state as saying that the April 22 terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir could not have happened without Lashkar-e-Taiba's (LeT) support

title: Govt taking steps to curb cyber crimes: Jyotiraditya Scindia
content: During the discussion in the Lok Sabha, Union Communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said that the Ministries of Communications and Home have taken major measures to deal with cyber crimes.

title: Singapore visit: CM Chandrababu Naidu aims to attract strategic investments into Andhra Pradesh in real estate, green energy, eco-tourism sectors
content: In a separate meeting with Mike Barclay of Mandai Wildlife Group, CM Chandrababu Naidu discussed collaboration in developing wildlife parks, eco-tourism circuits, biodiversity complexes and immersive wildlife experience zones

title: Tripura to set up STF to combat organised crime, extremism
content: Home Secretary Abhishek Singh said the STF will be headed by an SP-rank officer under the supervision of an IG or DIG

title: IIT Madras-incubated Plugzmart develops platform connecting EV chargers to multiple networks
content: Currently, most EV chargers are locked to one CMS, meaning, customers of only that one EV brand could utilise the charger. Plugzmart’s solution breaks this limitation by introducing an intelligent middleware that enables multiple CMS connections for a single charger

title: Durg prison authorities in Chhattisgarh assure LDF delegation from Kerala of shifting ailing nuns to district hospital
content: Catholic Bishops’ Conference of India to move District Sessions Court in Durg to secure bail for the arrested nuns

title: Four children, seven Bangladeshi nationals held while returning to Bangladesh
content: “All of them belong to Baliadanga village in Batiaghata police station area of Bangladesh’s Khulna district,” an officer said

title: Hyderabad | ED raids at eight locations in connection with ₹700 crore sheep distribution scam
content: Those targeted in the raids were identified on the basis of financial transactions that raised red flags during the preliminary inquiry, officials said

title: ED conducts searches in ₹500-cr Chhattisgarh medical supply 'scam' case
content: Premises linked to some government officials, medical suppliers and agents apart from some "middlemen" are being raided in Raipur, Durg and adjoining places, officials said.

title: Bahmani fort featured in Mann Ki Baat, home to ‘world’s longest cannon’, is in state of ‘utter neglect’
content: The fort houses the second largest mosque in Asia, renowned for its unique architectural features, but both have been in a state of ‘utter neglect for decades’

title: 3 arrested with heroin worth ₹20 lakh
content: Acting on a tip-off, a joint team of the state police and CRPF intercepted a vehicle at the Banderdewa check gate

title: Behala College first State-aided institution in Kolkata to earn autonomous status
content: Behala College formally received the conferment of autonomous status from the University Grants Commission on July 28

title: Amarnath Yatra suspended on Pahalgam, Baltal routes due to heavy rains in Jammu and Kashmir
content: The yatra will remain suspended from Jammu too on Thursday (July 31, 2025) due to the inclement weather conditions

title: Andhra liquor scam: SIT unearths ₹11 crore cash from farmhouse near Hyderabad
content: Based on the confessional statement given by one of the accused in the liquor scam, the SIT police carried out search operation on the farmhouse and confiscated the cash

title: Betting app case: Actor Prakash Raj appears before ED in Hyderabad
content: The ED suspects that such endorsements were disguised as entertainment or charitable content, while actually promoting unregulated gambling apps

title: Nehru criticism: Congress slams PM Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah saying they suffer from ‘obsessive-compulsive disorder’
content: "They have NO answers to their present-day failures. They have NO answers to legitimate questions that are being raised on their policies and actions," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said

title: India reiterates support at UN for two-state solution to Israel-Palestinian conflict
content: India said it has been clear on the measures that must be undertaken in the short term for a ceasefire and also stressed that the plight of the hostages should not be forgotten

title: Trump wants call with PM Modi before final approval on India-U.S. trade deal
content: Donald Trump’s intent to speak with “his friend” Narendra Modi has reportedly been conveyed to New Delhi

title: Bihar govt announces hike in incentive for rural health workers ahead of Assembly polls
content: ASHA workers will now be provided with an incentive amount of ₹3,000 instead of ₹1,000, says Chief Minister Nitish Kumar in a post on X

title: Gujarat ATS arrests woman suspected of links to terror module from Bengaluru
content: The suspect, identified as Shama Parveen, a native of Jharkhand, was staying at a rented accommodation in Hebbal.

title: LIVE: Supreme Court reserves ruling on Justice Yashwant Varma’s plea against in-house committee report
content: The former Delhi High Court judge is facing an impeachment motion following a probe into allegations that large sums of cash were recovered from his official residence in New Delhi

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 8 LIVE: ‘No calls between President Trump and PM during Operation Sindoor’ says Jaishankar
content: During the Zero Hour, Congress MP K.C. Venugopal raising concerns about the arrest of two nuns in Chhattisgarh sought they be released immediately.

title: RTI Commission dealing with 18,000 pending cases
content: An RTI awareness conference held at Prajavani Hall aimed at training Public Information Officers (PIOs) on the legal provisions and responsibilities under the RTI Act

title: Justice on hold: India’s courts are clogged
content: Civil cases in district courts face the longest delays, exposing a stark mismatch between caseload and capacity

title: Lions Club hands over insulin cartridges to welfare society
content: This was in response to a recent news report in The Hindu, which highlighted the concerns of the children and their parents in view of some changes in the ‘Mittayi’ scheme of the Kerala Social Security Mission

title: Maini Group co-founded SUN Mobility raises $135 million to fund its global foray
content: This capital infusion will drive the company’s plans to set up the largest battery swapping network in Africa and also to fuel SUN Mobility’s domestic growth

title: Tara Murali – a crusader for heritage of all kinds
content: Fire is the element that defined Tara. She burnt with a desire to set things right, across a wide variety of causes, bringing to them all her characteristic thoroughness and desire for forthright action

title: Conservationists’ fight to protect ‘Perfect Unanimity’, the British-era building on the Marina
content: The episode of the campaign to save the DGP office complex was recalled by many, while mourning the passing of veteran architect-conservationist Tara Murali in Chennai last week

title: Tracing the route of King Rajendra Chola’s Gangetic expedition
content: Accounts reveal the Chola forces defeated kingdoms in the eastern Deccan, coastal Odisha, and eventually clashed with the Pala dynasty in Bengal

title: A.P. CM Naidu discusses partnership in key sectors with Singapore President
content: The Chief Minister emphasises the importance of collaboration in knowledge economy, infrastructure development, semiconductors and renewable energy

title: India’s tea production increases in 2025, Darjeeling’s output remains a concern
content: The production of tea across the country from January to May 2025 stood at 336.22 million kg compared to 267.36 million kg between January to May 2024

title: Army recruitment rally in Kakinada from August 5 to 20
content: The process is fully automated, fair, and transparent, and the candidates are advised to guard against touts

title: Drug menace in Karnataka: BJP Yuva Morcha demands resignation of CM and Home Minister
content: The morcha will take up a campaign against drugs besides launching a Statewide protest against the Congress government for alleged failure to act sternly against the menace

title: Insurance can better cataract surgery outcomes for India’s elderly: study
content: After controlling for other factors, having any insurance made an elderly patient 38% more likely to end up with ‘good’ uncorrected vision, a team from the L.V. Prasad Eye Institute has found

title: Couple booked for alleged bid to extort ₹30 crore from IT firm owner
content: The accused are Swetha Babu and her husband Krishnaraj of Thrissur. The case was registered on a complaint by Venu Gopalakrishnan who runs a company at Infopark Kochi

title: Himachal makes dope testing for ‘Chitta’ mandatory in police recruitment
content: The Cabinet decided to introduce mandatory dope testing for ‘Chitta’ (heroin) during police recruitment

title: NHRC flags food poisoning in Telangana residential schools, seeks report on 886 incidents and 48 student deaths
content: The issue came up for discussion during NHRC’s two-day camp sitting in Hyderabad, where it took up over 100 human rights cases specific to the State

title: Infant rescued in baby-selling racket placed under State care
content: Officials said the infant will undergo routine medical examination while authorities await further directions regarding his custody and care

title: Agilent Tech opens Biopharma Experience Centre in Hyderabad
content: Hyderabad hosts 8 of top 10 global pharma firms, over 230 U.S FDA-approved manufacturing units and five of India’s leading healthcare chains, Industries and IT Minister Sridhar Babu told the inauguration

title: Supriya Sule alleges ‘₹4,800-crore scam’ in Ladki Bahin Yojana
content: Her allegations come two days after the Maharashtra government announced a temporary suspension of ₹1,500 monthly aid to 26.34 lakh beneficiaries following a verification drive

title: Congress MLAs play flute before ‘buffalo’ in unique protest at M.P. Assembly; Speaker asks ministers to give direct answers
content: Congress MLAs enacted the popular Hindi saying ‘bhains ke aage been bajana (playing flute before a buffalo)’ which means that there is no point of saying anything to someone who won’t do anything about it

title: Writers, progressive thinkers oppose reduction of SSLC pass percentage in Karnataka
content: Writers, progressive thinkers, and educationists have written a letter to the Chief Minister in this regard

title: IT/ITeS union cheers Karnataka government’s move to scrap proposal on increasing work hours
content: The union members visited the Additional Labour Commissioner’s office on Tuesday to register their concerns about a recent layoff announcement by TCS

title: Kerala High Court yet again expresses displeasure at shoddy condition of Kochi roads
content: Potholes abound on MG Road and Banerjee Road; unscientific and damaged manhole covers and undulating paver blocks also a cause for concern, says court

title: Navy Chief on four-day visit to Japan to boost defence and maritime cooperation
content: The Chief Admiral CNS is scheduled to hold bilateral discussions with senior Japanese government officials including Minister of Defence, Gen Nakatani

title: MA&UD approves 11 projects to enhance urban liveability
content: Approved projects include development of waste to energy facility in Kurnool, Kadapa, Nellore and Kakinada-Rajahmundry, construction of a modern bus stand in Chittoor, monetisation of land at Rushikonda and ropeway to Kailasagiri

title: Will make efforts to enhance devotee experience during Dasara: NTR Collector
content: Number of devotees visiting the temple during the 10-day festivities has been increasing every year, and this year around 1 lakh devotees are expected every day, says G. Lakshmisha

title: Five new corporations under GBA: Final notification to come out on September 2
content: Public invited to file objections, if any, to the draft notification by August 18; delimitation process to be conducted on September 8

title: Mamata unfazed after Delhi police claim video she posted was fabricated
content: Hundreds of migrant workers from West Bengal have alleged harassment and torture by police in different states, including Delhi, because they are suspected of being Bangladeshi nationals

title: Chidambaram gave clean chit to Pakistan: Amit Shah
content: The Home Minister says there is evidence that the three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam terror attack were Pakistanis because Pakistani voter numbers of two out of three terrorists are available and the chocolates found with them were also made in Pakistan

title: Meghnad Desai, eminent Indian-born economist and author, dies at 85
content: Described as being at the “forefront of discussions on Indian public policy for many years”, Desai also had an illustrious teaching career

title: Rajnath urges international community to curb terror funding, labels Pakistan as ‘nursery of terrorism’ in Rajya Sabha
content: Defence Minister initiates debate on Operation Sindoor in Rajya Sabha; criticises UNSC’s appointment of Pakistan to counter-terror panel

title: Gujarat High Court acquits three in 2002 post-Godhra riots case, cites lack of ‘reliable evidence’
content: The three men were accused of being part of a mob in Anand that damaged and set shops on fire, violating prohibitory orders issued under Section 135 of the Bombay Police Act

title: DGCA audit flags 51 safety lapses in Air India’s operations
content: The Tata Group-owned airline is already facing warning notices for running planes without checking emergency equipment, not changing engine parts in time and forging records, along with other lapses related to crew fatigue management.

title: Assam begins eviction drive to clear encroached forest land on Nagaland boundary
content: The settlers had turned vast swathes of land in the Rengma Reserve Forest into betel nut plantations, officials said

title: Bihar: Nitish announces 3x pay hike for Asha workers; Mamta incentives doubled
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Cristiano Ronaldo, Jamal Musiala head FUTTIES Team 3 in EA FC 25
content: a 99 in Shooting, 98 in Passing and 95 in Pace, makes him an exceptionally dangerous player to face . the duo have a 98 OVR card, 96 in Dribbling and 94 in shooting . jamal Musiala joins the team at the head of the squad with a monstrous 99 .

title: From the Texans to the 49ers, our ranking of every team based on under-25 talent
content: for the third straight year, the Houston Texans are no. 1 on this list of teams with the most under-25 talent . a year ago, the texans were way ahead of everyone else when it came to ranking talent under 25 years old .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Lamar Jackson dazzles with long TD; Malik Nabers 'OK'
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room .

title: 🎮 EA Sports reveals '99 Club' for Madden NFL 26
content: squon barkley was confirmed as a member of the iconic 99 Club . he'll be the only player to start off with a 99 OVR . his blocking stats are well over 90 across the board . the Buffalo Bills quarterback sports immense general stats .

title: Brock Purdy and wife, Jenna, announce birth of first child
content: Purdy's wife, Jenna, gave birth to the couple's first child, millie Joleen . the 49ers' new arrival came nearly two weeks after star running back Christian McCaffrey and his wife had their first child .

title: Why Ichiro, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are Hall of Famers
content: Ichiro Suzuki, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame . the trio stands out for their disparate backgrounds . they were a star in the Japan Pacific League at 20 years old before becoming the first Japanese position player .

title: Reinier de Ridder surges into the middleweight top 10
content: Reinier de Ridder is a top contender in the 185-pound division . he now owns a spot in the ESPN middleweight rankings, bumping Whittaker down a couple of spots in the top 10 . here are the current pound-for-pound MMA rankings .

title: 'It's about standards and details': Man United, Amorim aiming to start anew
content: Ruben Amorim arrived in the us for man united's preseason tour with a smile back on his face . he snapped back at reporters who suggested the performance had been poor . but time back in Portugal has allowed for a reset and at the start of a pivotal summer for the club .
